channel.title: Gauntlet Community - The Gauntlet Forums
channel.description: Topics in the 'Gauntlet Community' category For general discussion of the Gauntlet community as a whole. (Not for miscellaneous/general discussions nor finding players.) It is a place to discuss Gauntlet created content (eg. blog, Codex, and podcasts), give shout outs to wonderful members of the community, and the like.

item.title: Gauntlet Video Roundup Announcement - November 8, 2019
item.dc:creator: @flatvurm
item.description:
@flatvurm wrote:

Greetings, all! This week’s Gauntlet Hangouts video roundup post is now up on The Gauntlet Blog!

We’ve got some great new series kicking off with games like Root, Afterlife: Wandering Souls, Primetime Adventures, and more! Plus check out the new “Gauntlet TTRPG Chat” feature. Thanks to everyone who facilitated and played, and if you want to join in the fun, head over to the Gauntlet Hangouts category on the Forums to see the latest game announcements, and sign up on the Gauntlet Hangouts Calendar to play!

item.title: Age of Ravens: History of Post-Apocalyptic RPGs (Part One: 1976-1984)
item.dc:creator: @edige23
item.description:
@edige23 wrote:

PA Banners.jpg1534×500 165 KB

With this being NaNoWriMo and the holidays coming up, I’ve decided to present a greatest “Age of Ravens” hits for the next several weeks. To that end, I’m presenting the first installment of each of my History of RPG Genre posts, along with links to the reset of the series. I start in the wastelands of Post-Apocalyptic RPGs today with 1978’s Metamorphosis Alpha (the first game I played after D&D).
THE GAUNTLET

AoR: History of Post-Apocalyptic RPGs (Part One: 1976-1984)

With this being NaNoWriMo and the holidays coming up, I've decided to present a greatest "Age of Ravens" hits for the next several weeks. To that end, I'm presenting the first installment of each of...

item.dc:creator: @flatvurm
item.description:
@flatvurm wrote:

Greetings, all! This week’s special Gauntlet Con edition of the Gauntlet Hangouts video roundup post is now up on The Gauntlet Blog!

You can catch all the recorded Gauntlet Con 2019 games on this YouTube playlist, and you can also catch the panels, workshops, and live podcast episodes on this playlist. Thanks to everyone who facilitated and played, and thanks to everyone who made Gauntlet Con 2019 such an amazing experience! If you want to join in the fun (which continues all year round), head over to the Gauntlet Hangouts category on the Forums to see the latest game announcements, and sign up on the Gauntlet Hangouts Calendar to play!

item.title: Reminder about PPP: Providing Positive Posting
item.dc:creator: @RedMagus77
item.description:
@RedMagus77 wrote:

Hello Gauntleteers! Just a reminder about our tone and tenor for posting here on the forums, as we’ve observed some behaviors that have had us concerned, and we wanted to reach out to the community as a gentle notice about it

  • There is no Wrong Way to Play - Whether they enjoy traditional gaming, classic play, storygames, OSR, or some mix, everyone has the freedom and right to enjoy a game. There is no correct way to play, and while we are a site that focuses heavily on Storygaming and OSR, please refrain from negative talk about other styles of gaming, or about others who come in asking about flaws in OSR/Storygame systems. We want an open and honest conversation about all three topics, both the good and the bad, and having open discussion without a demand to acknowledge one as “The Best” or “The Worst”

  • Intent does not excuse Impact - When writing, take a moment to look over what you’ve written and go “is this in the most charitable and caring light?” and remember to phrase statements in ways that assume the other side of the conversation has read the same materials you have, and that their experiences and questions are made as a good faith inquiry. While we all come from different backgrounds and experiences, we are all equals in gaming, and we should reflect that in our conversation, and encourage people to share ideas and experiences. Couch your language as a kind inquiry, not a demand, such as “this reminds me of when X happened at our table, have you had this occur?” or “What were your thoughts about the text on page 137, as that seems to be directly related to your concerns?”

  • If not an Explicit Yes, then No - If you pose a question and it is ignored, you are welcome to re-ask the question in the course of the conversation and help build the narrative. However, continually asking individuals to justify their position or provide you an answer to your satisfaction is unfriendly behaviour and can result in the person feeling Othered or unwelcome to the community. If you want more information, or want to continue the debate, consider both asking the person on their experiences, as well as asking them their feelings on an item. And if a person has declined to continue a particular subject, do not continue asking or tagging them in that subject or similar subjects. Conversation is about coming to understand another person, not forcing them to accept your opinion as the best or demanding your satisfaction.

  • Low/No Content Posting - Please do not make posts containing no content (ie, “first post,” “I want to follow this”, “that’s interesting” etc.). These just litter up the forums and we need to eliminate these as much as possible. If you want to show support for someone’s comment, click the Heart Icon to show it.
    As a general rule, write as if you were speaking in real life to another human being.

As always, we encourage everyone to be kind and caring, and to help keep our community friendly and welcoming. The Moderation Team is always available and you may always flag a post, either as one of the pre-generated options, or as “Something Else” if you want to go into more details on what you believe is going on. We check every report and do our best to respond to them as a unified group as well as ensure we all thrive as a community of Good Gaming.

Posts: 2

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Reminder about PPP: Providing Positive Posting

item.title: Gauntlet Con 2019 - Thank You!
item.dc:creator: @RichardRuane
item.description:
@RichardRuane wrote:

I won’t retype the whole thing here (so that everyone tagged doesn’t want to strangle me for tagging them every place I can), but I wanted to share my thank-you Twitter thread for everyone who worked on Gauntlet Con: https://twitter.com/Arr_Roo/status/1189329535860432896

I also wanted to say thanks to @seanFsmith and @RoryM for their generosity in prize support and volunteer rewards. I don’t know the two of you on Twitter, but didn’t want your generosity to go without saying a very public thanks!

Richard Ruane
Gauntlet Con 2019

Participants: 3

item.title: Hearts of Wulin: Romance of the Golden Dragon - A question
item.dc:creator: @Indris
item.description:
@Indris wrote:

Hello all!

Nice to meet you!

First of all, I want to thank all of the participants in this AP for giving us a wonderful story to listen to! HoW is such a beautiful game (I’m still super sad that i totally missed that Kickstarter )

Now, here’s my question: It seems that the last part of that series (part 4) has not been uploaded to the podcast channel. Is that possible? I couldn’t find it on my app on the i-phone. I see that there is a VoD on youtube of it.
I’d really love to finish this story, preferably via podcast.

If i may, i’ll add another question: there are a lot of HoW APs on the podcast (yay!), any recommendations in what order I should listen to them? Any that stand out in quality? As said, Romance of the Golden Dragon was very enjoyable for me…so if any of the others are as good or even better, I’m sold.

Thanks in advance!

And thanks again for sharing your stories with us!

Posts: 10

Participants: 3

Read full topic
item.source: Hearts of Wulin: Romance of the Golden Dragon - A question
